creator: PobbyHeglar
title: Stailess Steel Outdoor Led Sign
materials_required: 24 volt ul listed outdoor 35w power supply
LED strips in waterproof shrink wrap
description: This project details the construction of a weatherproof, illuminated, and durable outdoor sign made of stainless steel with LED lighting for a restaurant. The sign incorporates a textured stainless steel face and a plastic backing for mounting the power supply and LEDs.
steps: Create a concept design in CorelDraw and get customer approval. Create sample textures on SS sheets to show customer different options. The final texture was made by putting a curved 1/8th inch round bar behind the sheet and hitting it with a soft deadblow hammer. After that sand blasting it to dull the finish to an eggshell or flat and then sanding off the high spots with 220 in on orbital sander to brighten the high spots. Sand and sandblast plastic samples to create a two-tone effect.

Set up the cut file with borders. Texture the SS before cutting to keep it flat. Cut the SS on a water jet. Put all the edges through a sheet metal break. Tig weld the corners, grind them, sandblast to hide the welds, and sand again with 220.

Create a frame for the LEDs from leftover SS strips. Weld the strips to create a 90-degree angle and cap it off with a 1 3/4 inch strip for mounting the face. Cover the frame with a spray-on rubberized coating. Route holes in the plastic backing for wires, power supply mounting, and alignment pins. Route the edges of the plastic for a clean finish. Attach the waterproof LED strips.
The project is completed and installed.
